thread.title: Grammy winners Pentatonix finally getting airplay
thread.title_full: Grammy winners Pentatonix finally getting airplay

author: KRISTIN M. HALL
title: Grammy winners Pentatonix finally getting airplay
text:
Donn Jones Grammy winners Pentatonix finally getting airplay 
In this Sept. 4, 2015, photo, Kevin Olusola, from left, Kristie Maldonado, Scott Hoying, Mitch Grassi and Avi Kaplan of the group Pentatonix pose for a portrait at Sony Music Nashville in Nashville, Tenn., to promote their latest album, "Pentatonix" (Photo by Donn Jones/Invision/AP) Donn Jones Grammy winners Pentatonix finally getting airplay 
In this Sept. 4, 2015, photo, Avi Kaplan from left, Kristie Maldonado, Scott Hoying, Mitch Grassi and Kevin Olusola of the group Pentatonix pose for a portrait at Sony Music Nashville in Nashville, Tenn., to promote their latest album, "Pentatonix" (Photo by Donn Jones/Invision/AP) Donn Jones Grammy winners Pentatonix finally getting airplay 
In this Sept. 4, 2015, photo, Avi Kaplan from left, Kristie Maldonado, Scott Hoying, Mitch Grassi and Kevin Olusola of the group Pentatonix pose for a portrait at Sony Music Nashville in Nashville, Tenn., to promote their latest album, "Pentatonix" (Photo by Donn Jones/Invision/AP) Posted: Friday, October 16, 2015 8:33 am | Updated: 11:00 am, Fri Oct 16, 2015. Grammy winners Pentatonix finally getting airplay Associated Press | 
NASHVILLE, Tenn. (AP) — Pentatonix already has a Grammy, millions of fans on social media and platinum album sales, but there was still something missing for the five-part vocal group. 
With the release of their new single, "Can't Sleep Love," the a cappella group is finally getting airplay for a song they wrote.
